DOC.brief_summary: Supplementation with DHA during pregnancy will increase gestational length and improve cognitive development.
DOC.detailed_description: This was a trial of supplementation with DHA during pregnancy to increase gestational length. Subjects were provided with 300 mg, 600 mg or placebo (olive oil) in a randomized design from week 24-26 of pregnancy until delivery. Gestational age, birth weight and birth length data were collected and infants growth at 2 and 4 months and cognitive development at 4 months and 1 year were measured.
DOC.criteria: singleton pregnancy 18 years of age or older cervical incompetence presence of cervical cerclage placenta previa intrauterine infection known substance abuse multiple fetuses current preeclampsia preexisting diabetes
